repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

comment_data.body: Do we want to remove `long` or just keep it as an alias for `int`?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -279,8 +279,7 @@ def declare_in_type(self, self_type):
 # resulting in unintuitive runtime behavior and segfaults.
 #    ("bool",   "&PyBool_Type",     []),
 
-    ("int",     "&PyInt_Type",     []),
-    ("long",    "&PyLong_Type",    []),

comment_data.body: Hmm. Use cases? I only see `isinstance(x, (int, long))` in code that wanted to support Python 2.x. Everything else probably meant C `long` instead. And code that wanted to keep supporting Python 2 would probably be better off with a compilation failure when migrating to Cython 3.1 instead of mapping it to Python 'int'.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -279,8 +279,7 @@ def declare_in_type(self, self_type):
 # resulting in unintuitive runtime behavior and segfaults.
 #    ("bool",   "&PyBool_Type",     []),
 
-    ("int",     "&PyInt_Type",     []),
-    ("long",    "&PyLong_Type",    []),

comment_data.body: I don't really have a use-case in mind. There's probably some old code around that this change will break, but it's an easy enough fix anyway so it's probably OK
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -279,8 +279,7 @@ def declare_in_type(self, self_type):
 # resulting in unintuitive runtime behavior and segfaults.
 #    ("bool",   "&PyBool_Type",     []),
 
-    ("int",     "&PyInt_Type",     []),
-    ("long",    "&PyLong_Type",    []),

comment_data.body: I kept the name `long` available in language level 2, mapping it directly to the `int` type.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -279,8 +279,7 @@ def declare_in_type(self, self_type):
 # resulting in unintuitive runtime behavior and segfaults.
 #    ("bool",   "&PyBool_Type",     []),
 
-    ("int",     "&PyInt_Type",     []),
-    ("long",    "&PyLong_Type",    []),

tree 85b7ae6423a1ae16f70948c197f0eaeb6e284738

author scoder <stefan_ml@behnel.de> 1700200799 +0100
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1700200799 +0100

Merge branch 'master' into infer_pyint

commit.message: Fix a test after removing the Python "long" type.
Remove dead Py2 code referring to Python "long".
Fix "implicit conversion from double float" C compiler warning in a test.
Remove Python 'long' type usage from a test.
On unary operators (+/-/~), Python builtin types usually return their own type or fail, so infer their type.
Re-allow 'long' as type in Py2 code (language_Level=2) but map it to 'int'.
Improve error message and fix tests.

milestone.description: Remove support for Python 2 and Python < 3.8.
